definition: to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: He is also deaf in his right ear from the operation he had to remove the tumor.
sentences.chinese: 因为割除肿瘤的手术，也导致了他右耳失聪。

sentences.english: Again, a biologist cuts out an eyeball.
sentences.chinese: 一位生物学家再一次割除了一个鲸眼球。

sentences.english: Then the surgeon cut me open and take out the appendix and stitched me up again.
sentences.chinese: 医生切开我的腹部，割除了阑尾，又把我腹部缝好。

sentences.english: He had a tumour. When it had been removed, his paedophilic tendencies went away.
sentences.chinese: 当他的脑瘤被割除的时候，他那些怪癖消失了。

sentences.english: I know you see me resecting this bowel.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你在看我割除这段肠子。

sentences.english: His right ear was taken off.

definition: to root out/to eliminate the roots/to cure once and for all
to sew together/suture (in surgery)/to sew up (a wound)
slang/argot/private language used as secret code
incision/notch/slit/gash/margin of a page/trimmed edge (of a page in a book)
to pluck/to pull off/to pull out/to unplug
